title: Half way through my final promotion game for diamond, I was disconnected and unable to reconnect?
body: I have never had this problem before, and am wondering if I was ddosd or if it was just a server problem on riots end?

replies.body:
http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/summary/id=43ca253f-8770-5c6e6555-5aa6-4092-8c86

Just played a normal game, and it ran fine. As i said previously, this has never happened to me before. Is it possible to have that loss revoked?

Hey there,

First off let's deal with the problems I notice from your netalyzr results.

* The packet buffering on your connection seems rather high, you should close any programs that arent needed when playing league to help lower this value, A list of programs known to increase packet buffering are below.
  * Skype
  * Teamspeak
  * Ventrillo
  * Hamachi
  * Spotify
  * Anything that streams HD video content (i.e. Youtube, Twitch etc)
  * Torrent programs (i.e. uTorrent)
  * Active downloads (i.e Steam)

* Your systems clock seems to be out of sync by quite a large value, please [sync your systems time with an internet time server](http://www.guidingtech.com/3119/windows-clock-sync/).

Now onto your question regarding the loss, unfortunately setting the match to a state of loss prevented isn't possible.
Loss Prevented is only enabled during periods of widespread server downtime.

Hey there,

That's definitely an odd one, did that happen just now? If not, has it happened since?

Could you please run the [ICSI Netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) for me and post a link to the results.
